title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum has been assigned to the Maine Celtics for practice as he continues his recovery from an Achilles injury.
Tatum participated in 5-on-5 scrimmages and workouts, pushing for a return to the Boston Celtics after missing since May 2025.
Brad Stevens emphasized Tatum will return only when fully healthy, ensuring he integrates smoothly back into the Celtics lineup.

title: Hikers rescued in Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Two Canadian hikers rescued near Camel's Hump mountain in Duxbury, Vermont, faced life-threatening cold conditions.
Rescue teams reached the hikers at 11:20 p.m., finding them with hypothermia amid sub-zero temperatures and heavy snow.
The rescued hikers, from Ontario, are expected to fully recover; Vermont covers rescue costs for those in need.

title: 6 offseason priorities for Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots need to address offensive line vulnerabilities after allowing six sacks in Super Bowl LX against Seattle.
New England aims to add another offensive weapon for quarterback Drake Maye, considering options like A.J. Brown and Alec Pierce.
Patriots face decisions on which free agents to retain while preparing to extend cornerback Christian Gonzalez's contract.

title: For this St. Lucian runner, the Boston Marathon is ‘nothing short of a dream’
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Ava Fevrier is competing in the 2026 Boston Marathon representing the Lingzi Foundation.
Fevrier aims to be the first St. Lucian woman to complete all six world marathon majors.
After starting road running post-2019, Fevrier holds the St. Lucian national record for marathon distance.

title: Actor Henry Winkler named Emerson Collegeâ€™s 2026 commencement speaker
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Henry Winkler, Emerson College alumnus, will deliver the 2026 commencement address at Wang Theatre on May 9.
Winkler, known for 'Happy Days' and 'Barry,' is also an advocate for children with learning differences.
Emerson College will honor Winkler for embodying the values of creativity, curiosity, and expression.

title: Score 20% off JetBlue flights to 3 destinations from Boston with Squares4Fares
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: JetBlue offers 20% off flights from Boston to Fort Lauderdale, Daytona Beach, and Phoenix through its Squares4Fares sale.
The discount is valid for travel until March 18, but flights must be booked by February 10.
The promotion excludes Friday and Sunday travel, with a limit of one promo code per booking.

title: State Police academy supervisor and 3 instructors charged with manslaughter in death of recruit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police academy staff charged with manslaughter in Enrique Delgado-Garcia's 2024 death during unauthorized boxing exercises.
Sgt. Jennifer Penton and Troopers Edwin Rodriguez, David Montanez, and Casey LaMonte face charges, including causing serious bodily injury.
Massachusetts State Police suspended boxing from training curriculum amid reforms following Delgado-Garcia's death and ongoing independent reviews.

title: OpenTable names 2 Massachusetts restaurants among the most romantic in the U.S.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: OpenTable named Sorellina in Boston and Pellana Steakhouse in Peabody among the Top 100 Romantic Restaurants in the U.S.
The list was based on over 9 million verified diner reviews and dining metrics from Dec 2024 to Nov 2025.
Sorellina offers Italian-Mediterranean cuisine, while Pellana specializes in steakhouse fare with prime beef and seafood.

title: New on Netflix and more: Top streaming picks for February 2026
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Ex Machina', 'Hell or High Water', and 'You've Got Mail' are new on Netflix in February 2026.
Catherine O'Hara's notable performances in 'A Mighty Wind', 'Home Alone', and 'Schitt's Creek' highlighted.
Boston.com staff recommends 'The Pitt', 'People You Meet on Vacation', and 'Secret Mall Apartment' for streaming.

title: What the Patriots need to do in the off-season, according to readers
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston.com readers emphasize improving the Patriots' offensive line as a priority for the offseason.
79% of poll respondents were not surprised by the Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss, citing offensive line issues.
Suggestions include drafting offensive linemen, signing a new offensive line coach, and getting a top quality wide receiver.
